channel.title: Projects - Isaac Newcomb
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Isaac Newcomb

item.title: SnapSlide
item.description: What's that sound? My individual project for Mechatronics (MAE 3780 at Cornell): a pitch-corrected slide whistle.

item.title: Peeler-Corer-Slicer (CAD Project)
item.description: As an exercise for Mechanical Synthesis (MAE 2250 at Cornell), I replicated my favorite kitchen tool in Fusion 360.

item.title: The Saga of Kirbotty McFinioFace
item.description: My team's Cube Craze robot was bright pink and plastered with memes, but the neat breadboards and reliable mechanisms brought us to the podium.

item.title: A Helping Hand for the Gym
item.description: At Camp No Limits, I collaborated with prosthetists and a congenital amputee to design and print her a terminal device for her workout routine.

item.title: Ice Keys
item.description: I didn't like how melodicas sounded, so I 3D printed an acoustic keyboard that sounds like polyphonic pan pipes.
